item.description: After entering the permalink structure "/%year%/%monthnum%/%day%/%postname%/", links to the default static page "about" do not work any more. clicking on â€‹http://url.tld/about/ results in getting the front page.

item.title: Ticket #1072 (list_cats() ignores 'optionall=1' option) updated
item.dc:creator: little_ram
item.description: Apologies for the double submission :-)

item.title: Ticket #1072 (list_cats() ignores 'optionall=1' option) reopened
item.dc:creator: little_ram
item.description:
Here's some code which fixes this. It adds 2 more SQL calls (which are only called if optionall=1) and also allows for optiondate, feed, feedimage with the 'All categories' link.

Scroll to this line in the file: 

	$num_found=0;
	$thelist = "";

Add this code straight afterwards: 

	if ( $optionall )
	{
		$link .= '<a href="' . $PHP_SELF . '" title="View all posts">' .
						$all . '</a>';
		// rss link
		if ( (! empty($feed_image)) || (! empty($feed)) ) {
			$link .= ' ';
			if (empty($feed_image)) {
				$link .= '(';
			}
			$link .= '<a href="' . bloginfo('rss2_url') . '"';
			if ( !empty($feed) ) {
				$title =  ' title="' . $feed . '"';
				$alt = ' alt="' . $feed . '"';
				$name = $feed;
				$link .= $title;
			}
			$link .= '>';
			if (! empty($feed_image)) {
				$link .= "<img src='$feed_image' $alt$title" . ' />';
			} else {
				$link .= $name;
			}
			$link .= '</a>';
			if (empty($feed_image)) {
				$link .= ')';
			}
		}
		// post count
		if (intval($optioncount) == 1) {
			$total_posts = $wpdb->get_results(" SELECT COUNT(ID) AS pc
			FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_status = 'publish'
			AND post_date_gmt < '$now' $exclusions");
			$link .= ' ('. $total_posts[0]->pc .')';
		}
		// latest post date
		if ( $optiondates ) {
			$max_date = $wpdb->get_results(" SELECT UNIX_TIMESTAMP( MAX(post_date) ) AS ts
			FROM $wpdb->posts
			WHERE post_status = 'publish'
			AND post_date_gmt < '$now' $exclusions");
			if ( $optiondates == 1 ) $optiondates = 'Y-m-d';
			$link .= ' ' . gmdate($optiondates, $max_date[0]->ts);
		}
		if ($list) {
			$thelist .= "\t<li>$link\n";
		} else {
			$thelist .= "\t$link<br />\n";
		}
	}

I've attached the whole file as well (template-functions-category.php), just in case.

item.title: Ticket #1723 (All private and draft posts can be retrieved via XML-RPC) created
item.dc:creator: kevinh
item.description: Regardless of what username and password I use, I can retrieve a blog's entire set of draft and private posts via the metaWeblog.getRecentPosts XML-RPC API call. If these posts are to be retrieved, they should at least be marked with an mt_keyword or category that denotes the post status (published, draft, or private).

item.title: Ticket #1721 (Move smilies to smilies_init() that hooks into init()) created
item.dc:creator: asknight
item.description:
vars.php calls get_settings() on 'siteurl' and 'home' which can both have filters defined, before filters are declared in the setup stream.

Can impact (and does in my case save for my hack) smilies, COOKIEPATH, and SITECOOKIEPATH. The last two potentially critical in setting user cookies properly.

item.title: Ticket #1720 (dropdown_cats() should be deprecated in favor of a modified ...) created
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: Concerns arose from a â€‹WordPress support thread about the dropdown_cats() template tag. Users are confused as to why dropdown_cats() doesn't have an option to output without the select html tags when wp_get_archives() does. I propose dropdown_cats() be deprecated and list_cats() be rewritten to use a function similar to get_archives_link().

item.title: Ticket #1719 (Action hook for user deletions?) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
fixed:

Don't hate me... I went to go look into making a patch for this, and it's already in WP 1.6! :-)

{{

do_action('delete_user', $id);

}}

item.title: Ticket #1719 (Action hook for user deletions?) created
item.dc:creator: Fredster
item.description:
One of my plugins (Private Notes) maintains tables of notes and folders in the database on a per-user basis. When a registered user is deleted, there's no real way for my plugin to know that it's happened, so I had to hack out a function that's basically a "delete from the notes and folders tables where owners exist that don't also exist in the wpdb->users table."

It works, but it seems like it'd be smoother if there were a 'delete_user' hook, so I could just stick in an 'add_action' call and have the hook call my function, passing in the ID of the user being deleted.

This ticket is being entered at the request of MarkJaquith on #wordpress.

item.description: $strip should default to true, not false, for backward compatibility with themes that don't understand this field. Otherwise you're going to get odd breakage in quite a few themes.

item.title: Ticket #1511 (Users page should sort by role seniority, not by role alphabetically. ...) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
Two points:

1.Removing and re-adding a role would reorganize the role list so the concept of seniority (which is only coincidal from the way the roles are added by the installer) wouldn't be true.

2.There is no intrinsic indicator in the name of a role that one role is greater than another, so seniority of a role is not apparent to a user from its name.

Consider - you are looking at an English dictionary in which the words are ordered by some number of "seniority" I have applied to each word. This number is not visible anywhere near the word's definition. Choose a word, open to a random page, and then tell me if the word you chose appears before or after that random page.

So although you might be able to organize roles using the order they appear in the database, there is no indicator to the user that the roles are sorted that way, or what the sort value is for the role they're looking for, especially if they've customized the roles.

Don't commit this patch - sort by alpha only.

item.title: Ticket #1716 (Setup Email Error) created
item.dc:creator: rebz
item.description:
when wordpress installs itself, it sends an email to the "admin" of the website if there are commas in the wordpress blog name it messes up in the "from" address for instance, my blog name was "Creativity, Innovation, Entrepreneurship" and it sent it from 3 separate email addresses

Just figured I'd let you guys know :D

(Copied from IRC)
